citeinfo.origin: Sistemas de Informacin Geogrfica, S.A. de C.V.
citeinfo.title: Mexico Rivers and Streams, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
Mexico Rivers and Streams is a polyline theme representing the major rivers and streams in Mexico. Attribute information includes the name, type, status, rank and length of the water feature.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: Mexico Rivers and Streams provides a base map layer of major rivers and streams within Mexico.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:300,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy is not known.

citeinfo.title: Proyecto Mxico Informacin Cartogrfica Digital

pubinfo.publish: Sistemas de Informacin Geogrfica, S.A. de C.V.

citeinfo.origin: Sistemas de Informacin Geogrfica, S.A. de C.V.
citeinfo.title: Proyecto Mexico 1:200,000

pubinfo.publish: Sistemas de Informacin Geogrfica, S.A. de C.V.

citeinfo.othercit: This is the source for ESRI Data & Maps 2006 Mexico Rivers and Streams that is used to code the RANK attribute.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded data set from the Sistemas de Informacin Geogrfica, S.A. de C.V. FTP site. Removed coastlines and water polygon boundaries, and several tiny sliver polygons. Clipped the features at the international border. Corrected miscoded features. Added attributes NAME, TYPE, STATUS, and RANK. Translated the Spanish values in the source OBJETO attribute to English and put them into the TYPE and STATUS attributes. Populated the NAME attribute with the title case version of the values of the source NOMBRE attribute and changed "SIN NOMBRE" to blank. Added the KILOMETERS attribute and calculated its values. Coded the RANK attribute from RANK in 2006 Mexico Rivers and Streams using the Near geoprocessing tool. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Corrected the spelling of the TYPE attribute value from 'Aquaduct' to 'Aqueduct'. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the major rivers and streams in Mexico.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The rank of the river or stream based on the length of its connected river system.

edom.edomvd: The feature/system is greater than 764 kilometers in length.
The feature/system is between 403 and 764 kilometers in length.
The feature/system is between 162 and 402 kilometers in length.
The feature/system is between 81 and 161 kilometers in length.
The feature/system is less than 80 kilometers in length.

attr.attrdef: The length of the river or stream in kilometers.
